Well that is different than 6 weeks ago scans. So I would call that regression not stable. Thoughts???

Posts.Content: Ready2Win wrote: Hi Everyone I wanted to share my good news. I had my PET scan yesterday and they called today with the results. Things are stable!! I was in the ER last week with horrible pains in my pelvic and back pain. They sent me home and said it was a UTI. The PET showed that I have a kidney stone stuck between my kidney & bladder causing back up. That explains the pain that was worse than child birth! Anyways, that's all that was new. I have to follow up with a urologist. Dx 12/20/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: PET Results Ready2Win Lowrider54

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2011 02:06AM Ready2Win wrote: I have been on TDM1 since Nov. 2010.  It is working really well. The tumors in my liver have shrunk by 50%. I have scans again this week.  I get it every 3 weeks.  The side effects are not bad at all.  You do not lose your hair.  I am alittle tired pretty much all the time but I can still work and take care of my kids age 5 & 7.  Other than that the side effect are minimal. Constipation for a day or two, dry mouth for a day, thats about it.  I have to get blood work every week to watch my liver numbers and I get a PET every 6 weeks.  (alittle too often if you ask me)  They also monitor your heart with MUGAs.  Where are you in Ohio?  I am in PIttsburgh and I participate in the trial at Magee UPMC.Maybe that is closer for your mom. Good Luck.  PM me if you have any other questions

Posts.Title: NEW TO CHEMO!! Brenna-30yrsold-NYC CoolBreeze

Posts.Content: Ready2Win wrote: Hello Ladies, I do not post very often but I visit all the time.  You all have been a source of strength and knowledge for me.  Thank you.  My husband got some upsetting news yesterday at work.  We both work for Verizon and when they found out last January that I was diagnosed with breast cancer everyone wanted to help.  I was diagnosed from the beginning with Stage 4.  It spread to the bones.  We have 2 small children ages 4 & 6.  At the time my husband did not know how things were going to turn out and was assigned to a garage approximately 1 hour away.  He asked his boss if there was anyway to get closer to home.  We have 3 garages within 20 mins from us.  They agreed and we were very greatful.  I made it through CHEMO and multiple rounds of radiation.  Finally, in December we were told that the disease in STABLE in my bones.  I continue to go for treatment (Herceptin & Zometa) every 3 weeks.  Yesterday, his boss called and says we heard your wife is doing better you are being transferred back to your old garage.  He was so insensitive and ignorant.  He was only concerned with his numbers. I cant believe the company that I have been so loyal and dedicated to has treated us some badly.  Did I mention that I didnt take one day off through all my treatments?  I am so hurt.  I need help with the kids.  The side effects from the treatments have me very achy and sore.  The damage to my hip has me walking with a limb and my entire left leg is numb.  I dont know what to do but I want Verizon upper management to be aware of this without negatively impacting our jobs.  We still have to work for them.  Any suggestions? Dx 12/20/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help....Verizon is so insensitive to their employees Ready2Win 3katz

Hang in there.  BTW I have mets to the bone and liver. I was diagnosed in 2008 at age 32. It sucks but You can do this!!!

Posts.Content: Ready2Win wrote: I am so frustrated with the hospital.  How long does it normally take to get into a trial?  As you may recall I posted last week that my recent scans said I had disease in the liver and that it has increased in size since my scans in  JULY.... however there was never a mention of any new disease in JULY on the report.  So I have been continuing on with this current treatment thinking I was still Stable with bone METs. Now I just got a copy of my PET from last week and I find out that I have 2 lessions on my liver 1 on my hip that I knew about and "increased FDG AVIDITY of BONY METASTASIS INVOLVING THE T4 SPINOUS PROCESS AND LEFT LAMINA"  What does that even mean? WHere is that in my body? I am waiting to get into a trial comparing TDM1 and Xeolda&Tykerb.  ANyway.... I have been trying to watch what I eat and juice alot but at this point I am about to have a bacon cheese burger.  I hate this disease! Dx 12/20/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2011 05:26PM Ready2Win wrote: I don't know how I missed this but wanted to add my two cents. I was on Herceptin and Aromasin and had progession to my liver in Nov 2010. I am on TDM1 since and the liver is almost clear. 1 tumor left only 18mm. It is given every 3 weeks by a 1/2 infusion. It is very well tolerated with minimal side effects. It hardly slows me down. I think it is worth looking into. Good luck!
